fields.physical_description: Ladder back chair, primarily of mahogany but with beech front and side seat rails
fields.dimensions: Height: 5 cm, Width: 63.5 cm, Depth: 61 cm, Height: 48 cm
fields.marks: 'IM' (the I with serifs) stamped on the underside of the back seat rail.
fields.history_note:
Linnel ladderback chair, gift of Eric M Browett, 29 George Road, Edgbaston, Birmingham, in memory of his wife

Notes from R.P. 3429

Listed on gift form among 34 pieces donated
As "1 chair ladderback and honeysuckle - W.72"
(n.b. another ladderback chair W.74 is on the same list - referred to by the donor in earlier correspondence as "1 fine ladderback single chair from Clapton House").

23/7/37, letter Ralph Edwards to Browett in response to the gift
"we hope to make a special exhibition of your gift and to show it to the press in the early Autumn, when ….a few trifling repairs have been carried out.  Examining the furniture at leisure, I am even more impressed with its quality and importance than when I saw it in your house".

29/6/37, Browett notes in making the gift
"the only merit I claim is that the collection has been gathered together on a very slender income, and as the ….articles….represent practically the whole of my life's savings the items which I am giving to your Museum constitute a very real sacrifice".

31/8/37 letter the Director, Maclagan, to Browett
thanks "for the invaluable assistance which you have given us by your generosity.  It is not very long since our collection of English Furniture was universally recognised as being hopelessly inadequate…..the acquisition of so many first rate examples together marks a really notable step in its improvement….Visitors…will..be deeply indebted to your taste and liberality".

9/10/37 by Ralph Edwards for Country Life
on the subject of the V & A's special exhibition of Browett's gift.

There are no specific references to the chair, its history or condition on the nominal file.
